timeline.message: Merge branch 'master' of https://github.com/JMRI/JMRI into TestFixes
Merge branch 'master' of https://github.com/JMRI/JMRI into TestFixes
check for logging init by looking for appenders.
test linting; and some tolelrance for window positioning
test linting; use disable instead of assume
linting; one graphics disable per file (for file of all graphical tests)

timeline.bodyText: Why a new class and not adding logging initialization to jmri.util.JUnitLoggingUtil? (its likely going to be confusing having JUnitLoggingUtil and LoggingTestUtil)
timeline.author: rhwood
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,151 @@ +package jmri.util; + +import java.io.*; +import java.nio.file.Files; +import java.util.*; + +import javax.annotation.Nonnull; + +import jmri.util.exceptionhandler.UncaughtExceptionHandler; + +import org.apache.log4j.*; +import org.slf4j.Logger; +import org.slf4j.LoggerFactory; + +/** + * Common utility methods for working with Log4J in tests. + *

+ * Two system properties influence how logging is configured in JMRI: + *

+ *
jmri.log
The logging control file. If this file is not an + * absolute path, this file is searched for in the following order:
    + *
  1. JMRI settings directory
    2. + *
  2. JMRI installation (program) directory
    3. + *
+ * If this property is not specified, the logging control file + * default.lcf is used, following the above search order to find it. + *
+ *
jmri.log.path
The directory for storing logs. If not specified, + * logs are stored in the JMRI preferences directory.
+ *
+ * + * @author Bob Jacobsen Copyright 2009, 2010 + * @author Randall Wood Copyright 2014, 2020 + */ +public class LoggingTestUtil {

replies.bodyText:
LoggingTestUtil handles initialization of the logger.
JUnitLoggingUtil is, per the the class description, utilities for handling special case logging messages in tests.
Putting both tasks in a single class violates the single responsibility principle.
I would have named the new class Log4JUtil, but there is a, now deprecated, class with that name already in the package.
replies.author: pabender

replies.bodyText: @rhwood I renamed the class TesttingLoggerConfiguration. That should eliminate the confusion.
replies.author: pabender

timeline.bodyText:
I just wanted to point out the subtle bug in this line.
The & happens before the |, so the result of the & doesn’t matter because the | with a constant always makes the value nonzero.
The solution is to put the | in parentheses. I moved that line to the oBlockOccupiedOrAllocated method.
timeline.author: pabender

timeline.bodyText:
Please do this for X as well as Y. When I run this test on my laptop with Debian Linux, I consistent get wrong X values on some items. I don't know why, but by adding your code, but for the X axis, removes the problem.
In the tests that failes, x=0 is expected, but I get x=-5.
timeline.author: danielb987

replies.bodyText: sure, thanks for the suggestion.  I did a little refactoring at the same time.
replies.author: pabender

replies.bodyText: Thanks. The static analysis failed since line 197 and 198 of LoadAndStoreTestBase should have xposition_regexe instead of yposition_regexe.
replies.author: danielb987

replies.bodyText: Yeah, I saw that.  should be fixed now.
replies.author: pabender
